overview_of_class: In dystopian stories the ills of society run riot. As a film genre, dystopian owes much to satire, science fiction, and fantasy and yet is distinct from them. Examples include: The Hunger Games, Children of Men, and The Handmaid's Tale. In this class, we will view and discuss examples of dystopian films in order to understand the conventions of the genre, the anxieties it explores, and why these stories captivate today's audiences. By the end of the quarter, students will complete an original screenplay for a short film (20 to 30 minutes) or a treatment for a feature film, detailing a three-act story, and a completed first act.

descriptions.value: In dystopian stories the ills of society run riot. As a film genre, dystopian owes much to satire, science fiction, and fantasy and yet is distinct from them. Examples include: The Hunger Games, Children of Men, and The Handmaid's Tale. In this class, we will view and discuss examples of dystopian films in order to understand the conventions of the genre, the anxieties it explores, and why these stories captivate today's audiences. By the end of the quarter, students will complete an original screenplay for a short film (20 to 30 minutes) or a treatment for a feature film, detailing a three-act story, and a completed first act.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: To learn effective writing strategies and become familiar with the elements of the dystopian genre in order to create stories that resonate with a contemporary audience.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Attendance, written assignments, and class participation.

descriptions.value: Handouts & articles given in class on specific topics and the work generated by classmates.

descriptions.value: Students must come to the first class with a story premise in mind.

overview_of_class: Students will learn how to create a feature-length screenplay for a limited budget. By creating and workshopping a completed first or second draft of a script, students will learn about story structure, autobiography, self-production, creative casting and other do-it-yourself aspects of starting and finishing a microbudget movie.
name: Topics in Media Writing
title: SoC RTVF 360-0-23 Topics in Media Writing

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Students will learn how to create a feature-length screenplay for a limited budget. By creating and workshopping a completed first or second draft of a script, students will learn about story structure, autobiography, self-production, creative casting and other do-it-yourself aspects of starting and finishing a microbudget movie.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will have a working knowledge of and fresh empowerment to tackle the full-length microbudget screenplay.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Students will be evaluated based on writing progress and engagement with in-class discussions, screenings and fellow student evaluations.
